item.title: Fernanda add a quote by Boris Pasternak
item.description: "I don't like people who have never fallen or stumbled. Their virtue is lifeless and it isn't of much value. Life hasn't revealed its beauty to them. " -- Boris Pasternak

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "I like not only to be loved, but also to be told that I am loved. I am not sure that you are of the same mind. But the realm of silence is large enough beyond the grave. This is the world of light and speech, and I shall take leave to tell you that you are very dear." -- George Eliot

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "The great tragedy of life is not that men perish, but that they cease to love." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by Mary Zimmerman
item.description: "Let me die the moment my love dies. Let me not outlive my own capacity to love. Let me die still loving, and so, never die." -- Mary Zimmerman

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by Christina Rossetti
item.description: "Ah me, but where are now the songs I sang When life was sweet because you call’d them sweet?" -- Christina Rossetti

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by Christina Georgina Rossetti
item.description: "Who has seen the wind? Neither you nor I: But when the trees bow down their head, The wind is passing by." -- Christina Georgina Rossetti

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by Christina Rossetti
item.description: "My heart is like a singing bird." -- Christina Rossetti

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by Christina Rossetti
item.description: "All things that pass Are wisdom's looking-glass." -- Christina Rossetti

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by Christina Rossetti
item.description: "Better by far you should forget and smile than that you should remember and be sad" -- Christina Rossetti

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by Christina Georgina Rossetti
item.description: "Remember me when I am gone away, gone far away into the silent land." -- Christina Georgina Rossetti

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I have the choice of being constantly active and happy or introspectively passive and sad. Or I can go mad by ricocheting in between." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "Remember, remember, this is now, and now, and now. Live it, feel it, cling to it. I want to become acutely aware of all I’ve taken for granted." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Love is something more stern and splendid than mere kindness." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "There is never a time or place for true love. It happens accidentally, in a heartbeat, in a single flashing, throbbing moment." -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "Love is needing someone. Love is putting up with someone's bad qualities because they somehow complete you." -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "I am coming to terms with the fact that loving someone requires a leap of faith, and that a soft landing is never guaranteed." -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "Silence is so freaking loud" -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "The fate of your heart is your choice and no one else gets a vote" -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by Georg Christoph Lichtenberg
item.description: "The thoughts written on the walls of madhouses by their inmates might be worth publicizing." -- Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by Stephen Crane
item.description: "Camp fires, like red, peculiar blossoms, dotted the night." -- Stephen Crane

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by Stephen Crane
item.description: "The moon had been lighted and was hung in a treetop." -- Stephen Crane

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by Stephen Crane
item.description: "It appeared that the swift wings of their desires would have shattered against the iron gates of the impossible." -- Stephen Crane

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by Gilda Radner
item.description: "I wanted a perfect ending. Now I've learned, the hard way, that some poems don't rhyme, and some stories don't have a clear beginning, middle, and end." -- Gilda Radner

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "This is a good sign, having a broken heart. It means we have tried for something." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Fernanda add a quote by Emily Brontë
item.description: "I wish I were a girl again, half-savage and hardy, and free." -- Emily Brontë
